result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas F Kafer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid from his prison wages.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas F Kafer in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas G. Halloran.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea to the amended information. Court imposed the following sentence: 

9 month county jail to run concurrent with present sentence
Court costs of $88.00 to be paid out of his prison wages.
Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
From Oshkosh Correctional

Jury status hearing on September 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas F Kafer by video, in custody, with attorney Thomas G. Halloran by phone.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Halloran requests a trial date.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas F Kafer in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas G. Halloran.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Stephen Westphal from the City of Muskego was sworn and testified on the behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the state. Redirect by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. Court declares testimony closed. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense moves to dismiss and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant can be returned forthwith. Defendant to appear by video for his next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
